intro: Dieteria canescens var. ambigua, commonly known as the hairy dieteria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, this species thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant has a trailing growth habit and is often found in disturbed areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
